message: Hello Bob, I have a great product that I think you'll love. I'm willing to sell it to you for $120.
I'm really interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $90. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?
I understand you're looking for a good deal, Bob. However, I need to make a profit on this sale. I can do $110, and that's as low as I can go.
I appreciate your flexibility, but I was thinking more along the lines of $95. I really need to keep my costs low on this one. Can you meet me at $95?
I'm not willing to go as low as $95, Bob. I can meet you halfway between $110 and $95, which would be $102.50. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?
I appreciate the effort to meet me in the middle, but I'm still a bit above my budget. Would you be willing to consider $98? I think we're getting close to a deal.
I'm getting close to my minimum price, Bob. I can do $105, but that's as low as I can go. If you're not willing to meet me at that price, I'll have to consider other options.
I understand you're getting close to your minimum price, but I'm still trying to keep my costs low. Would you be willing to meet me at $99? I think we're getting close to a deal.

I've already said I'd go as low as $105, and you're asking me to go lower than that. I'm not willing to do that, Bob. If you're not willing to meet me at $105, I'm going to have to consider other options.
